sen.j: 角宮神社（すみのみやじんじゃ）は、京都府長岡京市にある神社である。
sen.e: "Suminomiya-jinja Shrine" is a shrine in Nagaokakyo City, Kyoto Prefecture.
"Suminomiya-jinja Shrine" is a shrine in Nagaokakyo City, Kyoto Prefecture.
"Suminomiya-jinja Shrine" is a shrine in Nagaokakyo City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Its old shrine ranking is township shrine.
Its old shrine ranking is township shrine.
Its old shrine ranking is township shrine.

sen.j: 式内社名神大社「山城国乙訓郡 乙訓坐大雷神社」の論社である（他の論社は向日神社（向日市）に合祀された「火雷神社」）。
sen.e: It is a ronja (shrines considered to be descendants of a shikinai-sha) of shikinai-sha (shrine listed in the Engishiki (List of Official Shrines)) myojin-taisha shrine 'Otokuni district of Yamashiro province Otokuninimasuohoikatsuchi-jinja Shrine' (the other ronja is the 'Honoikazuchi-jinja Shrine' enshrined together at the Muko-jinja Shrine (Muko City).

It is a ronja (shrines considered to be descendants of a shikinai-sha) of shikinai-sha (shrine listed in the Engishiki (List of Official Shrines)) myojin-taisha shrine 'Otokuni district of Yamashiro province Otokuninimasuohoikatsuchi-jinja Shrine' (the other ronja is the 'Honoikazuchi-jinja Shrine' enshrined together at the Muko-jinja Shrine (Muko City).

It is a ronja (shrines considered to be descendants of a shikinai-sha) of shikinai-sha (shrine listed in the Engishiki (List of Official Shrines)) myojin-taisha shrine 'Otokuni district of Yamashiro Province Otokuninimasu ohoikatsuchi-jinja Shrine' (the other ronja is the 'Honoikazuchi-jinja Shrine' enshrined together at the Muko-jinja Shrine (Muko City).
sen.cmt: provinceの頭文字を大文字にしました。区切れを入れ、Otokuninimasu ohoikatsuchi-jinja Shrineとしました。

sen.e: Enshrined deity
Enshrined deity
Enshrined deity

sen.j: 火雷神（ほのいかづちのかみ）を主祭神とし、タマヨリビメ・賀茂建角身命・垂仁天皇・春日神を配祀する。
sen.e: Honoikazuchi no kami is the main god worshipped, accompanied by Tamayoribime, Kamo Taketsunumi no mikoto, Emperor Suinin and Kasuga no kami.
Honoikazuchi no kami is the main god worshipped, accompanied by Tamayoribime, Kamo Taketsunumi no mikoto, Emperor Suinin, and Kasuga no kami.
Honoikazuchi no kami is the main god worshipped, accompanied by Tamayoribime, Kamo Taketsunumi no mikoto, Emperor Suinin, and Kasuga no kami.

sen.j: 「乙訓坐火雷神」については『山城国風土記』の賀茂神社縁起で、賀茂建角身命の子の玉依姫命が、火雷神が化身した丹塗矢によって懐妊し、賀茂別雷命が生まれたと記されている。
sen.e: Regarding 'Okutoninimasu honoikazuchi,' in the origin and history of Kamo-jinja Shrine described in the "Yamashiro no kuni Fudoki," it is mentioned that Tamayorihime no mikoto, the child of Kamo Taketsunumi no mikoto, was impregnated by Honoikazuchi no kami incarnated as a red arrow, and gave birth to Kamowake ikazuchi no mikoto.

Regarding 'Okutoninimasu honoikazuchi,' in the origin and history of Kamo-jinja Shrine described in the "Yamashiro no kuni Fudoki," it is mentioned that Tamayorihime no mikoto, the child of Kamo Taketsunumi no mikoto, was impregnated by Honoikazuchi no kami incarnated as a red arrow, and gave birth to Kamowake ikazuchi no mikoto.

Regarding 'Okutoninimasu honoikazuchi,' in the origin and history of Kamo-jinja Shrine described in the "Yamashiro no kuni Fudoki"(records of the culture and geography of the Yamashiro Province), it is mentioned that Tamayorihime no mikoto, the child of Kamo Taketsunumi no mikoto, was impregnated by Honoikazuchi no kami incarnated as a red arrow, and gave birth to Kamowake ikazuchi no mikoto.
sen.cmt: 『山城国風土記』の補足を加え、カンマの位置を移動しました。

sen.j: 賀茂建角身命と玉依姫命は賀茂御祖神社の、賀茂別雷命は賀茂別雷神社の祭神である。
sen.e: Kamo Taketsunumi no mikoto and Tamayori Hime no mikoto are the enshrined deities of Kamomioya-jinja Shrine, and Kamowake ikazuchi no mikoto is the enshrined deity of Kamowake Ikazuchi-jinja Shrine.
Kamo Taketsunumi no mikoto and Tamayori Hime no mikoto are the enshrined deities of Kamomioya-jinja Shrine, and Kamowake ikazuchi no mikoto is the enshrined deity of Kamowake Ikazuchi-jinja Shrine.
Kamo Taketsunumi no mikoto and Tamayorihime no mikoto are the enshrined deities of Kamomioya-jinja Shrine, and Kamowake ikazuchi no mikoto is the enshrined deity of Kamowake Ikazuchi-jinja Shrine.
sen.cmt: 前出の表記に合わせ、Tamayorihime no mikotoとしました。

sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 国史の初見は『続日本紀』大宝 (日本)2年（702年）7月8日条で、その後も祈雨の神としてたびたび朝廷からの奉幣があった。
sen.e: It is first seen in the history of the nation in the July 8, 702 section of the "Shoku-Nihongi (the second in a series of chronicles about Japan)," and thereafter frequently received hohei (offering a wand with hemp and paper streamers to a Shinto god) by the Imperial Court as the god for praying for rain.

It is first seen in the history of the nation in the July 8, 702 section of the "Shoku-Nihongi (the second in a series of chronicles about Japan)," and thereafter frequently received hohei (offering a wand with hemp and paper streamers to a Shinto god) by the Imperial Court as the god for praying for rain.

It is first seen in the history of the nation in the July 8, 702 section of the "Shoku-Nihongi" (the second in a series of chronicles about Japan), and thereafter frequently received hohei (offering a wand with hemp and paper streamers to a Shinto god) by the Imperial Court as the god for praying for rain.
sen.cmt: クォーテーション内のカッコ、およびカンマの位置を移動しました。

sen.j: 承久3年（1221年）の承久の乱で焼失し、長らく復興されないままになっていた。
sen.e: It burned down in the Jokyu Rebellion, and was not restored for a long time.
It burned down in the Jokyu Rebellion, and was not restored for a long time.
It burned down in the Jokyu War, and was not restored for a long time.
sen.cmt: 「○○の乱」の統一事項に基づき、"Jokyu War"としました。

sen.j: 文明 (日本)16年（1484年）、現在地に再興され、井ノ内の産土神とされた。
sen.e: In 1484, it was restored in its current location, as the guardian deity of birthplace in Inouchi.
In 1484, it was restored in its current location, as the guardian deity birthplace in Inouchi.
In 1484, it was restored in its current location, as the guardian deity birthplace in Inouchi.

sen.j: 明治6年（1873年）に村社に列格した。
sen.e: In 1873, it was ranked as township shrine.
In 1873, it was ranked as a township shrine.
In 1873, it was ranked as a township shrine.
